definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: So, upon finishing her exams, she fled home, thinking everything would be just as it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 於是，她一考完試就奔回家中，自以爲一切老樣子。

sentences.english: Oh, the same old same-old, you tell her.
sentences.chinese: 噢，還是老樣子，你告訴她。

sentences.english: At present, many of the institutions exist, but people remain much the same as they were.
sentences.chinese: 如今，很多體制都已經存在了，而人們仍然是老樣子。

sentences.english: She looked the same as always, and fortunately the rain had not caused a chill.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去是老樣子，幸運的是，那雨沒有使她受涼。

sentences.english: After that, it’s back to the old, negative thought patterns.
sentences.chinese: 然後，又回到老樣子，消極的思想模式。

sentences.english: The bedroom was exactly the same.
He was exactly what he had been when I knew him in Hertfordshire;
sentences.chinese: 他完全還是上次我在哈福德郡見到他時的那副老樣子。

sentences.english: Nobody liked it, and this year, they changed it back.
sentences.chinese: 沒人喜歡弄成這樣，於是今年，又都變回了老樣子。

sentences.english: The mountain village is no longer what it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 這個山村不再是以前的老樣子了。

sentences.english: Jade: Oh, you know, the usual, teaching aerobics, partying way too much.
sentences.chinese: 老樣子，教操，還有太多的聚會。

definition: cheerful and optimistic/in a good mood/gaily
what remains unseen is deemed to be clean/what the eye doesn't see, the heart doesn't grieve over (idiom)
to submit to the will of heaven/to resign oneself to fate/to trust to luck
to make oneself do sth in spite of adversity, pain etc
better to just get the pain over with, rather than prolong the agony
pinyin: chang2 tong4 bu4 ru2 duan3 tong4

definition: to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
to get straight to the point (idiom)
